newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys shr drops 4.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys shr drops 4.1 pct.

text.p: Shares of software firm Infosys Technologies Ltd fell on Tuesday after the central bank imposed curbs on foreign portfolio purchases in the stock, traders said.

The share fell 89.75 rupees, or 4.14 percent, to 2,080 by 0612 GMT. The stock had risen nine percent on Monday after the firm said its first quarter net profit rose 103 percent to 92.2 million rupees.
The Reserve Bank of India said on Monday that fresh purchases by foreign portfolio funds in the stock would need its prior approval because such holdings had reached a watch-list limit of 26 percent.
The ceiling on foreign fund holdings in the firm is 30 percent.
Traders said local players were offloading their positions following the announcement.
